Undergraduate students from 50 states and 55 countries

As a globally recognized leader in communication and the arts, Emerson College draws independent minds from diverse backgrounds around the world. This cultural dynamism creates an unmatched environment for intellectual exploration and creativity. It also makes acceptance to Emerson highly competitive. Our admission staff stands ready to help you organize your application.

We know that attending Emerson is an investment and that where you choose to pursue your education is an important decision to make. That’s why we’re constantly working to ensure our programs support a fulfilling life and a successful career. We will advise you on which of our programs—be it undergraduate, graduate, professional, or high school—matches your interests and supports your creative aspirations and goals.
If you’re an artist or communicator who is looking to find your voice and use it to create change, we welcome you to consider making Emerson the next stage in your journey.
Learn about the Undergraduate Admission process and meet the Admission staff who will show you how an Emerson education transforms your life and propels you to become a creative force.
The Office of Graduate Admission is here to help you explore your options for graduate study and understand how specific programs will support your career plans.
Take the next step toward your professional or academic goals by learning about the registration and payment process for Emerson College Professional Studies and Special Programs.

Welcome to Graduate Admission at Emerson College! We are here to help you explore your options for graduate study at Emerson and understand how specific programs will support your career plans. If you want to talk to a faculty member in your field or see our facilities before making a decision, we’ll arrange it. When you’re ready to take the next step, we make the admission process as welcoming and efficient as possible.

Explore our graduate programs and ways to connect with the Office of Graduate Admission, and take a quick minute to sign up to receive information, important updates regarding special on-campus events, and application notifications.

We are looking for students whose academic and professional backgrounds, communication skills, and passion for the field meet the demands of their chosen program and promise a successful career.

You are encouraged to apply as soon as possible, but no later than the deadlines listed below.

All applicants, with the exception of those applying to our on-campus Communications Disorders (MS) program, who are on active duty in the U.S. Military, are members of the U.S. Reserves or National Guard, or are Veterans of the U.S. Military will automatically have their application fee waived.
